instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message:
HellO all. 

Got a MacBook today. 
That does not boot. 
When i remover the cover and plugde the charger it booted
When i then press the d key on boot it passed all test 
When i replace the cover and i restart the systeem it does not boot 
Green light stays on when cover is in place 
When i then remove the cover i have to unplug the battery and when i then (without battery plugged) it boots 

It only happens whit cover, 

Btw no Asd for this model  ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message:
I had a similar problem with a machine where the spongy thing on the lvds connector was shorting all the pins when the cover was on. 
After placing capton tape around the connector it worked!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Crizz, post: 422"]I had a similar problem with a machine where the spongy thing on the lvds connector was shorting all the pins when the cover was on. 
After placing capton tape around the connector it worked![/QUOTE]

Seems it is something else fully taped it 
It boots a few times. But when battery is full it does not boot. Atleast thats what just happend ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message:
Unplugged battery
Replaced cover. 
Charger Goes in green light , 3 sec later orange light (battery stil unplugged)
Replaged charger more then 15 times everytime it boots

When battery connected, when it does not boot the charger light stays green, it boots when it turned orange

Dang i am gonne cry. Now it booted when charger was green charger was green and battery is 100%

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message:
Is the battery functional when connected and the cover is not in place? It seems like the cover is shorting something out in the battery or it is a very dead battery.
It is normal for the light to still turn orange even when the battery is disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message:
yes when i had the charger unplugged and the cover removed the systeem kept running
even if i have the charger unplugged with cover pressent  the system runs.
its really messing whit me

hmmm let me check battery, i dont have a spare one for this model.....i can only measure

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message:
hmmm this just made me very humble and feeling very stupid.

thanks Duke huge thanks, i was so focused on the cover, that no where in my mind the battery was something i was thinking about.

"somewhat" embarresed atm the battery gave a 2,2 volts, it just had inuf the work for a few short moments so that the test function was done (pressing D key when booting that small test)


:o:o:o:o

if it is running, and the battery is bad, can it make the systeem shutdown?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message: Yes it does, happens all the time when the battery expands in the case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message: Just boot into the OS and see if the battery charges...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot when cover is placed
threads.message:
Battery charges. But was at 95% when maseured

Battery was not expanded
